isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - WORK LIGHT W/48 AND 60 INCH FLAT ROOF SLEEPER AND 60 INCH CANTILEVER SLEEPER

svcproc.title: WORK LIGHT W/48 AND 60 INCH FLAT ROOF SLEEPER AND 60 INCH CANTILEVER SLEEPER
svcproc.para: When the work light switch is moved to the position, power flows from the B2 battery stud through circuit 14T, fuse F2-A, circuit 65A, work light switch (441), and circuit 65B to fuse L4. From the fuse power flows on circuit 65E to the left work light, and 65F to the right work light. The ground path is circuit 11T to 11F and sleeper ground for the left work light, and circuit 11S, 11T, and 11F to sleeper ground for the right work light. With the work light switch in the position, power also flows from fuse F4-A through circuits 13V, 28A, work light indicator light, circuit 65C, work light switch, and circuit 65-GC, 11-GBD, and 11-GBE to ground adapter (454), thus indicating that the work light switch is turned ON.
